title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel set in Airstrip One, formerly Great Britain, a province of the superstate Oceania.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: The story follows the main character, Elizabeth Bennet, as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel of the Roaring Twenties that shines a spotlight on the empty lives of the US upper class.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A rebellious teenager, Holden Caulfield, navigates his way through the complexities of adolescence.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: Captain Ahab’s quest for the white whale is a timeless epic—a stirring tragedy of vengeance and obsession.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A complex tale of families in Russia during the Napoleonic Era.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy featuring a struggle between good and evil in a mythical world.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A young Andalusian shepherd in search of a dream and his personal legend.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: Harry Potter, a boy who learns on his eleventh birthday that he is the orphaned son of two powerful wizards.

title: The Cat in the Hat
author: Dr. Seuss
summary: Two children sitting at home on a rainy day are visited by the Cat in the Hat, who shows them some tricks and games.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
author: Maurice Sendak
summary: A story about a boy named Max who, after dressing in his wolf costume, wreaks such havoc through his household that he is sent to bed without his supper.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
summary: The novel tells the story of a livestock pig named Wilbur and his friendship with a barn spider named Charlotte.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
summary: Follows the journey of a caterpillar eating its way through the week on its path to become a butterfly.

title: Green Eggs and Ham
author: Dr. Seuss
summary: A character known as 'Sam-I-am' pesters an unnamed character to taste a bizarre-looking dish of green eggs and ham.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: Harry Potter, a boy who learns on his eleventh birthday that he is the orphaned son of two powerful wizards.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
summary: A precocious girl named Matilda uses her intellect and telekinetic powers to overcome obstacles caused by her family and school's tyrannical headmistress.

title: The Giving Tree
author: Shel Silverstein
summary: A lifelong relationship between a boy and a tree as the tree constantly gives the boy everything he needs.

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
summary: Four English siblings are drawn into a magical world to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
author: Beatrix Potter
summary: Mischievous Peter Rabbit, who disobeys his mother and ventures into Mr. McGregor's garden, narrowly escapes disaster.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
summary: In a dystopian future, the totalitarian nation of Panem is divided into 12 districts and the Capitol. Each year two young representatives from each district are selected by lottery to participate in The Hunger Games.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: Harry Potter prepares for his ultimate battle against Lord Voldemort.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
summary: Two teens, both who have different cancer conditions, fall in love after meeting at a cancer support group.

title: Divergent
author: Veronica Roth
summary: In a world divided by factions based on virtues, Tris learns she's Divergent and won't fit in. When she discovers a plot to destroy Divergents, Tris and the mysterious Four must find out what makes Divergents dangerous before it's too late.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
summary: A boy wakes up in a Glade with other boys knowing only his name, not how he got there, or how to escape the enclosed walls. A girl arrives, the first ever, and the message she delivers is terrifying.

title: To All the Boys I've Loved Before
author: Jenny Han
summary: Lara Jean's love life goes from imaginary to out of control when her unexpressed crushes' love letters are mysteriously mailed out.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky
summary: An introvert freshman is taken under the wings of two seniors who welcome him to the real world.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
summary: Starr witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood best friend Khalil at the hands of a police officer. Now, facing pressure from all sides of the community, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what's right.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
summary: In a future society without hardship or free choice, young Jonas discovers a powerful truth and becomes determined to expose it.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
summary: Set during World War II in Germany, young Liesel finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others. Under the stairs in her home, a Jewish refugee is being protected by her adoptive parents.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
summary: In the marshes of North Carolina, a young woman named Kya lives alone, surviving as best she can in the wilderness.

title: The Great Alone
author: Kristin Hannah
summary: A family moves to Alaska in 1974 in hopes of living off the grid, only for the father's PTSD to cast a shadow over their lives.

title: Big Summer
author: Jennifer Weiner
summary: A social media influencer confronts body shaming, online trolls, and a former best friend who wants her to be maid of honor.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
summary: Two young people from different social classes in Ireland navigate their shifting feelings for each other.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
summary: In World War II France, two sisters face different dangers and make courageous choices.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
summary: A memoir of a woman who leaves her survivalist family in Idaho and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
summary: The former first lady recounts her life from her childhood in Chicago to her years in the White House.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
summary: An enigmatic artist and her family upend the lives of two picture-perfect families in an idyllic Cleveland suburb.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
summary: The goddess Circe navigates the world of the gods and mortals in this retelling of ancient Greek myth.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
summary: A woman's act of violence against her husband leaves her mute, sparking a therapist's obsession to uncover the truth behind her silence.
